title: 2020 United States presidential election in Maine
2020 United States presidential election in Maine
2020 United States presidential election in Maine
2020 United States presidential election in Maine
added: Maine became the first state to use [[Ranked-choice voting in the United States|ranked-choice voting]] for a presidential general election, with voters able to rank their preferred candidates on the ballot.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.pressherald.com/2019/09/06/governor-mills-allows-ranked-choice-voting-in-maines-presidential-elections/|title=Gov. Mills allows ranked-choice voting in Maine's presidential elections|first=Scott |last=Thistle |date=2019-09-06|website=Press Herald|access-date=2019-09-06}}</ref>  Majorities were reached in the first round of voting statewide and in each congressional district, so ranked-choice voting tabulation was not required.<ref>https://www.maine.gov/sos/cec/elec/upcoming/pdf/RCVpowerpointtimeline.UpdateJAN2021.pdf</ref>

title: 2020 United States presidential election in Maine
added: Maine became the first state to use [[Ranked-choice voting in the United States|ranked-choice voting]] for a presidential general election, with voters able to rank their preferred candidates on the ballot.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.pressherald.com/2019/09/06/governor-mills-allows-ranked-choice-voting-in-maines-presidential-elections/|title=Gov. Mills allows ranked-choice voting in Maine's presidential elections|first=Scott |last=Thistle |date=2019-09-06|website=Press Herald|access-date=2019-09-06}}</ref>  Majorities were reached in the first round of voting statewide and in each congressional district, so ranked-choice voting tabulation was not required.<ref>{{cite web|title=A Timeline of Ranked-choice Voting in Maine|url=https://www.maine.gov/sos/cec/elec/upcoming/pdf/RCVpowerpointtimeline.UpdateJAN2021.pdf|publisher=Maine Department of the Secretary of State}}</ref>
